body_html:
Dan: We also should not include the goldens in the TensorFlow repo since it would bloat the git history.

Marc I am not a fan of screenshot tests as small changes in the environments can have significant effects on the screenshots.

The size of the PNG files shouldn't be too problematic if we rewrite the screenshot tests to only be of the specific tiny components being tested.

I'd love to have only webdriver tests. It's just that TensorBoard is a visualization tool. So we definitely have to have screenshot tests for at least the plots.

Currently headless_shell is not supported on MacOS

If Headless Chromium doesn't work on Mac and Windows, then would it be possible for us to configure this tooling so the web tests, when run on those platforms, become a no-op with a warning? Also what about Windows? I've been talking to people and Windows seems to be in the works right now. So the build has to work on Windows and Mac from day one, even if "working" means doing nothing.

OOC: Mr. Jenkins: test this please
